almost.functional

Class Promise<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • almost.functional.Promise<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type the supplier is committed to provide.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable

    public class Promise<T>
extends Object
implements Runnable
    A runnable supplier promise. The supplier will be called on run() and if is succeeds or fails associated consumers will be informed. This implements Runnable so that it can be tucked into a Future etc.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Promise.State
      The current state of the promise.

      Constructors

      Promise.State getState()
      Get the current state of this promise.
      Promise<T> rejected(Consumer<Exception> consumer)
      Add a Consumer to be informed if the supplier throws an exception and is rejected.
      void run()
      This method calls the supplier and on successful completion informs the fulfilled consumers of the return value.
      Promise<T> settled(Consumer<Optional<T>> consumer)
      Add a consumer to be informed when the promise is settled either by fulfillment or rejection.

      • Promise

        public Promise(Supplier<T> supplier)

        Parameters:
        supplier - the supplier

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        This method calls the supplier and on successful completion informs the fulfilled consumers of the return value. If the supplier throws an exception the rejected consumers are informed. In either case when the call to the supplier completes the settled consumers are informed with an Optional containing the supplied value on success.
        Specified by:
        run in interface Runnable

      • fulfilled

        public Promise<T> fulfilled(Consumer<T> consumer)
        Add a Consumer to be informed upon successful completion of the invocation of the supplier.
        Parameters:
        consumer - the consumer
        Returns:
        this promise

      • rejected

        public Promise<T> rejected(Consumer<Exception> consumer)
        Add a Consumer to be informed if the supplier throws an exception and is rejected.
        Parameters:
        consumer - the consumer to inform
        Returns:
        this promise

      • settled

        public Promise<T> settled(Consumer<Optional<T>> consumer)
        Add a consumer to be informed when the promise is settled either by fulfillment or rejection. The consumer will be passed an Optional that will contain the value supplied if the promise was fulfilled.
        Parameters:
        consumer - the consumer
        Returns:
        this promise

      • getState

        public Promise.State getState()
        Get the current state of this promise.
        Returns:
        the state
